      findNextWithinPlaylist 
      com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistItem findNextWithinPlaylist(java.lang.String assetId)
      Find the next qualified asset for download, starting from the specified asset ID.
      public com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistItem findNextWithinPlaylist(java.lang.String assetId)
      Find the next qualified asset for download, starting from the specified asset ID. The behaviour of this search is influenced by whether searchFromBeginning is enabled for the playlist. If enabled then the search starts at the beginning of the playlist, and will return the first qualified item, but not the provided asset ID. Otherwise the search will start on the item following the provided asset ID. The returned item will already be set to the NEXT_ITEM status
      Specified by:
      findNextWithinPlaylist in interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylist
      Parameters:
      assetId - The asset ID on which to start the search, or to be skipped.
      Returns:
      The next item to download, which will be set to NEXT_ITEM status, or null otherwise.

      getItemsCursor 
      android.database.Cursor getItemsCursor()
      Get a cursor containing all of the items from the playlist.
      public android.database.Cursor getItemsCursor()
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Get a cursor containing all of the items from the playlist. The cursor will store the items in the order that they are stored in the playlist. The columns in the cursor can be found in PlaylistColumns
      Specified by:

      getItemsCursor 
      android.database.Cursor getItemsCursor(java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
      Get a cursor containing items from the playlist.
      public android.database.Cursor getItemsCursor(java.lang.String selection, java.lang.String[] selectionArgs, java.lang.String sort)
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Get a cursor containing items from the playlist. The items selected and sort order will be based upon the provided parameters and may not match the order in which the SDK will process them.
      Specified by:
      getItemsCursor in interface IPlaylist
      Parameters:
      selection - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows.
      selectionArgs - You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in the order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
      sort - How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which will match the order in which the SDK processes the playlist.
      Returns:

      getPendingCount 
      int getPendingCount()
      Count of assets that will auto-download if the Playlist has new items appended.
      public int getPendingCount()
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Count of assets that will auto-download if the Playlist has new items appended. This represents the number of assets that satisfied the Playlist auto-download rules, but for which no assets remained. If additional assets are appended to the playlist then the SDK will immediately auto-download as many new assets as is indicated by pendingCount as long as the playlist previously ended with assets that met the auto-download rules.
      Specified by:
      getPendingCount in interface IPlaylist
      Returns:
      the current count of items that will be downloaded if appended.

      Indicates Playlist status Active Playlists are enabled for smart-download. Any other status indicates smart-download is disable.

      hashCode

      isAssetHistoryConsidered 
      boolean isAssetHistoryConsidered()
      Controls smart-download next download selection logic.
      public boolean isAssetHistoryConsidered()
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Controls smart-download next download selection logic. Enabling this option will cause smart-download selction logic to consider asset history in addition to Playlist history, when determine what the next item to be downloaded on a Playlist. Example: 1) User downloads, plays, then deletes asset X 2) Next month, A playlist is created for which asset X is a member. VirtuosoPlaylistConfig is created with following settings: isAssetHistoryConsidered = TRUE isPlaybackRequired = TRUE 3) During smart-download find next, asset X will be skipped in Playlist, history shows asset X was downloaded, played, then deleted. Default is FALSE. TRUE: Check asset history FALSE: Do not check asset history.
      Specified by:
      isAssetHistoryConsidered in interface IPlaylist
      isEligible 
      boolean isEligible(com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistItem item)
      Determine if the delete on the asset in a playlist makes the playlist eligible for downloading another asset.
      public boolean isEligible(com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylistItem item)
      Determine if the delete on the asset in a playlist makes the playlist eligible for downloading another asset. The decision is based upon: 1) If the playlist is active 2) If playback is required then the item needs to have been played back 3) If asset history is considered then whether the asset has been played back in the IAsset records
      Specified by:
      isEligible in interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.internal.interfaces.autodownload.IInternalPlaylist
      Parameters:
      item - The playlist item being deleted
      Returns:
      true if the playlist should add another item, false otherwise
      isPlaybackRequired 
      boolean isPlaybackRequired()
      Controls smart-download trigger logic.
      public boolean isPlaybackRequired()
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Controls smart-download trigger logic. Smart-download is triggered when an asset is deleted via VirtuosoAsset.deleteAsset, OR when an Asset expires after playing. On trigger, this property is checked to see whether the Asset must ALSO have been played. If isPlaybackRequired is TRUE, and the Asset has NOT been played, smart-download is skipped. Default is TRUE. TRUE: Asset must have been played before smart-download starts. FALSE: Asset does not have to have been played before smart-download is triggered. WARNING: VirtuosoAsset.deleteAll will NOT trigger smart-download.
      Specified by:
      isPlaybackRequired in interface IPlaylist
      isSearchFromBeginningEnabled 
      boolean isSearchFromBeginningEnabled()
      Controls smart-download next playlist item search logic.
      public boolean isSearchFromBeginningEnabled()
      Description copied from interface: IPlaylist
      Controls smart-download next playlist item search logic. Default is FALSE. TRUE: Search from beginning of playlist, for first Asset (excluding asset that triggered smart-download) that does not exist on the device, and which has not been previously downloaded and deleted. FALSE: Search from Asset that triggered smart-download to next item in playlist that does not exist on the device, and which has not been previously downloaded and deleted.
      Specified by:
      isSearchFromBeginningEnabled in interface IPlaylist
